Rentista Visa for Romanians

Complete guide to obtaining the Rentista Visa (Residency for Passive Income) as a Romanian citizen. Specific requirements, timeline, and process for Romania passport holders.

Overview for Romanian Citizens

The Rentista Visa is for individuals with stable passive income from sources outside Argentina. This includes rental income, dividends, pension income, investment returns, or other passive revenue streams. As a Romanian citizen, you have visa-free entry to Argentina for 90 days that affect your pathway to this visa.

Is This Visa Right for You?

The Rentista Visa is designed for:

  • Retirees with pension income
  • Property owners with rental income
  • Investors with dividend/interest income
  • People with trust fund income
  • Those with royalties or licensing income
  • Anyone with stable passive income from abroad

Requirements for Romanians

Income Requirement

Proof of minimum $1,500-2,000 USD monthly passive income

Additional Requirements

  • â€¢ Income must be from passive sources (not employment)
  • â€¢ Income must be stable and documented
  • â€¢ Valid passport (6+ months)
  • â€¢ Clean criminal record (apostilled)
  • â€¢ Proof of address in Argentina

Document Checklist for Romanians

As a Romanian citizen, you'll need these documents:

  • Valid passport
  • Proof of passive income (bank statements, contracts, etc.)
  • Documentation of income source (property deeds, investment statements, pension letters)
  • Criminal background check (apostilled)
  • Birth certificate (apostilled)
  • Passport photos
  • Proof of address in Argentina
  • Criminal background check from Romania (apostilled) - Police clearance certificate required

Timeline & Process

Processing Time

60-90 days

Visa Duration

1 year (renewable)

Path to Citizenship

After 2 years of temporary residency, can apply for permanent residency â†’ citizenship

Step-by-Step Process

1

Entry to Argentina

Romanians can enter visa-free for 90 days. Use this time to prepare your application.

2

Gather Documents

Obtain all required documents from Romania. Note: Documents must be apostilled in Romania before travel.

3

Submit Application

Apply at the DirecciÃ³n Nacional de Migraciones (DNM) in Buenos Aires or your local migraciones office.

4

Receive Precaria

You'll receive a temporary authorization (precaria) allowing you to stay legally while processing.

5

Collect Residency Card

Once approved, collect your DNI (residency card) and enjoy your new life in Argentina!

Costs

Government Fee$300-500 USD
Legal Fees (optional)$800-2,000 USD
Total Estimated Cost$1,100-2,500 USD

Pros & Cons

Advantages

  • +No need for employment
  • +Designed for financially independent individuals
  • +Can lead to permanent residency
  • +Flexible - no work restrictions in Argentina
  • +Good for retirees and investors

Considerations

  • â€¢Must prove ongoing passive income
  • â€¢Higher income requirements than some other visas
  • â€¢Income must be from passive sources only
  • â€¢Annual renewal required initially

Frequently Asked Questions

Can I work in Argentina with a Rentista Visa?

Yes, unlike the Digital Nomad Visa, the Rentista Visa allows you to work for Argentine employers or start a business if you choose.

What counts as passive income?

Rental income, dividends, interest, pension income, royalties, licensing fees, and trust distributions. Employment income does NOT qualify.

How do I prove my income?

Bank statements showing regular deposits, contracts, property deeds, pension letters, investment statements - all showing consistent income of at least $1,500-2,000 USD monthly.
